Posts.Content: lovemyfriend wrote: Reading these various posts leads me to believe chemo isn't given to treat mets.  Does anyone have an answerr?  My friend, BJ, has Stage IV IBC, mets to bones, brain and lungs.  She was initially given 3 weeks of brain rads.and has also been on aromasin since her diagnosis (April 2009).  No chemo, just a recent Zometa infusion.  A double mastectomy has also been suggested for sometime in July.  Something doesn't sound right.  PS   I didn't realize until recently that BJ is somewhat unfamiliar with using the computer.  Hopefully she will let me show her how to use these forums, but for now I post and share answers with her. Posts.Content: lovemyfriend wrote: Please pray for my dear friend recently diagnosed with IBC, Stage IV.  Her husband, Joe, passed away tonight from a very long bought with emphysema.  It was a long painful death.  Why am I writing this?  Because it feels so unbelievably unfair.  Because my precious friend can barely face her own situation and her pain is beyond anything words can express.    Because Joe mattered!!!!!    I am going to print responses to this post for my friend.  Because I want her to know that in the world that seems so cruel and lonely tonight, others care about her pain because she is one of your sisters fighting this horrible disease.  Because I am scared to death that she will give up her own fight.  Thank you for reading this.  Thank you for your compassion.
